posts.title: Hexo setup
posts.text: This post is how I deploy hexo into github.io. Setup hexo12345678$ mkdir blog$ cd blog$ npm install hexo-cli # create ~/blog/node_modules$ export PATH=~/blog/node_modules/hexo-cli/bin:$PATH$ cd ~$ hexo init github_blog$ hexo generate$ hexo server Now open http://localhost:4000 to see the effect. Install icarus theme1234$ cd ~/github_blog$ git clone https://github.com/ppoffice/hexo-theme-icarus.git themes/icarus$ vi _config.yml theme: icarus deploy to githubcreate a repo call chihungtzeng.github.io in github web site. 12345$ vi ~/github_blog/_config.ymldeploy: type: git repo: git@github.com:chihungtzeng/chihungtzeng.github.io.git branch: master Install hexo-deployer-git to enable hexo deploy. 12$ cd ~/github_blog/$ npm install hexo-deployer-git go to github web site and register ssh keys: settings->SSH and PGP keys From now on, we can simply run hexo deploy to deploy our repo to github.io. Other icarus configs like qrcode are left for you to config. Test math: $a = \sqrt{2} + 3$. Add/Delete a page1234567# Add$ hexo new "Hello World!"# Delete$ rm ~/github_blog/source/_posts/My-screenrc.md$ hexo clean$ hexo generate
